item.description:
Invasive Plant Management Strategies For Urban Green Spaces, Home Landscapes and Community Gardens

Join Boston Natural Areas Network for an evening with paul Sutton, Coordinator for Open Space and Special Projects with the Boston Parks and Recreation Department and Ted Elliman, the Vegetation Management Coordinator with the New England Wildflower Society. Both are experts on invasive plants and will speak about the threat of invasive plant species, how to identify them and best management practices for controlling them in your green space.


Thursday, October 18th, 6:30- 8:00pm

Boston Natural Areas Network Office

62 Summer Street, 2nd Floor, Boston, MA 02110

For more information call 617-542-7696

or email Karen Chaffee at karen@bostonnatural.org
item.how_to_find_us: Downtown Crossing near the Orange, Red and Green Line stations. 62 Sumer St. but enter around the corner at Otis Street on your left.
item.name: Invasive Plant Management Strategies: Boston Natural Areas Network
